content:
To access a remote system from another system using its computer name, you can use a variety of tools and methods depending on your specific needs and environment. Here are a few common methods:

1. Remote Desktop Connection: If the remote system has Remote Desktop enabled, you can use the Remote Desktop Connection tool built into Windows to connect to it. To do this, open the Remote Desktop Connection tool by typing "mstsc" in the Run dialog box (Windows key + R), enter the computer name of the remote system, and click "Connect". You will need to have the appropriate credentials with administrative privileges on the remote system to connect.
2. PowerShell Remoting: If the remote system has PowerShell Remoting enabled, you can use the Enter-PSSession cmdlet to open a PowerShell session on the remote system from your local system. To do this, open PowerShell with administrative privileges, type "Enter-PSSession computername" where "computername" is the name of the remote system, and press Enter. You will be prompted for credentials with administrative privileges on the remote system. Once you are connected, you can run commands on the remote system as if you were physically sitting at it.
3. PsExec: If the remote system does not have Remote Desktop or PowerShell Remoting enabled, you can use the PsExec tool from Microsoft's Sysinternals suite to execute commands on the remote system from your local system. To do this, open a command prompt or PowerShell window with administrative privileges, navigate to the directory containing the PsExec tool, and use the following command:
```
psexec \\computername cmd
```
Replace "computername" with the name of the remote system. You will be prompted for credentials with administrative privileges on the remote system. Once you are connected, you can run commands on the remote system from the command prompt or PowerShell window.

These are just a few examples of ways to access a remote system from another system using its computer name. The specific method you use will depend on your specific needs and environment.
